remarks: Lemma for ~ abelth .  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 1-Apr-2015.)
statement:
abelth.1 $e |- ( ph -> A : NN0 --> CC ) $.
abelth.2 $e |- ( ph -> seq 0 ( + , A ) e. dom ~~> ) $.
abelth.3 $e |- ( ph -> M e. RR ) $.
abelth.4 $e |- ( ph -> 0 <_ M ) $.
abelth.5 $e |- S = { z e. CC | ( abs ` ( 1 - z ) ) <_ ( M x. ( 1 - ( abs ` z ) ) ) } $.
abelth.6 $e |- F = ( x e. S |-> sum_ n e. NN0 ( ( A ` n ) x. ( x ^ n ) ) ) $.
abelth.7 $e |- ( ph -> seq 0 ( + , A ) ~~> 0 ) $.
abelthlem5 $p |- ( ( ph /\ X e. ( 0 ( ball ` ( abs o. - ) ) 1 ) ) -> seq 0 ( + , ( k e. NN0 |-> ( ( seq 0 ( + , A ) ` k ) x. ( X ^ k ) ) ) ) e. dom ~~> ) $.
$d A k n x z $.
$d M k n x z $.
$d S k n x $.
$d X k n x z $.
$d k n ph x $.
